summary: bro dany was my fave but then i came on here and saw how the fandom treats her i was ???? the way the show seemed to take a lot...
question: bro dany was my fave but then i came on here and saw how the fandom treats her i was ???? the way the show seemed to take a lot of her softness from the books also made me :((
answer:
The block button will be your best friend.

Have yourself a soft book!Dany ogling a certain KiTN ;)

blog.name: showandwrite
blog.title: How I feel
blog.description: *DECEMBER GIFT PROMPTS ARE OPEN* You can find the instructions for these prompts over HERE *AUGUST PROMPTS ARE CLOSED* You can find the August prompts HERE *7 december prompts waiting to be written* *25 august prompts waiting to be written* You can find our masterlist here, our Mobile Masterlist here or you can check out our wattpad. "The least I can do, is explain how I feel." Let this Imagine blog be your way out, your world full of imagination, your world full of tragedy and happiness. We'll write short fanfics, short imagines and short preferences of all characters from the series :D (Teen Wolf, Shadowhunters, the Vampire Diaries, the 100, Game of Thrones, Fantastic Beasts and where to find them, Riverdale and The Originals)

summary: Advent Event - “You have something in your hair. Do you want me to get it out?” With Jon Snow
title: Advent Event - “You have something in your hair. Do you want me to get it out?” With Jon Snow
body:
“Good morning, Lady (Y/N).” Jon Snow bent his head slightly while he walked past you. His dark black curls danced in the wind and his black cloak whirled around his body.

You did remember the day when he had left Winterfell to serve the Night’s Watch. Although your mother had forbidden you to watch him, you had disobeyed her wishes and had orchestrated that you would walk by Winterfell at the time of his departure. You doubted if Jon knew you had been there. You doubted even more if it would have made any difference.

Even though you had secretly been in love with Jon ever since your paths had crossed, your mother had assured you at least a thousand times that there was no future for a relationship with a bastard. And you hated to admit it, but at that time you had thought she was right.

If only you had dared to voice your feelings despite your fear to end up outcasted and alone. If only there had been a way to know that one day Jon Snow would return from the wall, would free Winterfell from Ramsay Bolton and would be named King in the North.

Maybe then you would have had the courage to follow your heart.

“Good morning, King Jon.” You let his name and title roll of your tongue and you bent your knees and head slightly to make the perfect reference. “How is your day so far?” You were not sure if Jon had time to make conversation, but simply letting him walk past you while your heart was hammering in your chest remembering old times didn’t feel right either.

Jon shrugged in a very unkinglike manner. “Most meetings are quite boring.” He winked and his honesty surprised you. “I’ve known better days.” He furrowed his eyebrows and all of a sudden a memory seemed to surface. “As you probably already know, because you were part of each and every one of those better days.” He smiled and despite the redness reaching your cheeks you smiled back at him.

“Life is beautiful and easy and simple when you’re too young to understand the problems waiting for you around each river bend.” Your eyes met his and for a moment you couldn’t look away, his gaze holding you captive.

“If only we could have been children forever, without all those rules society uses to bring us down.” Jon nodded and instinctively you reached for his hand, realizing too late that probably it was not appropriate for a simple servant girl to touch her King.

Your voice was nothing but a soft whisper. “You are King now, Jon. You can make the rules. Maybe you are the first King creating rules to lift people up.” You quickly let his hand go again, but he curled his fingers around your wrist and pulled you closer towards him.

He opened his mouth to say something, but closed it again when the right words didn’t seem to come to him. His glance wandered over you and after almost a full minute he eventually cleared his throat. “You have something in your hair.” He paused. “Euhm…do you want me to get it out?” He leaned forward and you nodded, no sound capable of leaving your lips.

“Jon?” You eventually leaned on the tips of your toes, your nose barely a few inches away from his. “I know that you are King now and can’t return my feelings, but I do want you to know that I already loved you before you were a King.”

Jon bent his head and dropped his hand, the little spider he had saved from the tangles in your hair falling in the fresh green grass beneath his feet. “I know.” He pressed his forehead to yours. “If only we were still children and could simply do what our hearts desire.” He pressed a soft kiss on your slightly parted lips and then he stepped back. “Have a nice day, Lady (Y/N).”

“You too, King Jon.” You watched him walk away from your and then you touched your still tingling lips.

If only you had still been children indeed.

summary: peace never lasts, my dear. will you take a bit of advice from an old woman? he’s a clever man, your hand. i’ve known a great...
caption: peace never lasts, my dear. will you take a bit of advice from an old woman? he’s a clever man, your hand. i’ve known a great many clever men. i’ve outlived them all. you know why? i ignored them. the lords of westeros are sheep. are you a sheep? no. you’re a dragon. be a dragon.

blog.name: blackwidowsim
blog.title: Reylo/Jonerys
blog.description: *gifs*edits*Slytherin*Targaryen*Marvel*Star Wars*Game of Thrones*Riverdale*Chilling Adventures of Sabrina*Harry Potter*

summary: Mad Dany is stupid: An in-depth analysis of why there simply is no time for Dany going mad:
body:
Mad Dany is stupid: An in-depth analysis of why there simply is no time for Dany going mad:

I really don’t think season 8 of Game of Thrones has enough time to give us a mad Dany while they have to deliver us:

- proper dialogue between these many characters who never met before (Dany x everyone)

- give us all the emotions while reuniting characters (Arya, Sansa, Jon, Bran)

- expand these relationships to make them more believable (how will Tyrion and Sansa interact? Will Sansa show Cersei what she has leaned from her?)

- continue plot lines from former seasons because that was one of the things that made Game of Thrones special (Will Arya kill Melisandre (Mel said they will meet again)?; will it be mentioned that Arya „would be Gendry‘s lady“?; will Euron get the golden company?; will he meet the second sons?; will they be loyal to Dany or change sides?)

- good character developments (how will Cersei interact now that Jamie left her?; what does the Night King want?; Will Arya become more sensitive?; Is Jamie now fully over Cersei?)

- long battles: there are at least 2 battles (White Walker battle and Cersei battle) and each will definitely be an episode long.

There might even be on against Euron or the battles are longer so you only have a maximum of 4 episodes left to create a reasonable Dark!Dany plotline while also including everything above. And yes I say reasonable because season 7 did NOT end with Dany burning people, it ended with her agreeing to destroy the Night King, traveling North to save Westeros, crying over Viserion and talking to Jon about her doubts (deserving the thrones).

As a conclusion: It ended with her being madly in love with Jon.

Why is this important?

Because the only reason why Dany would turn AGAINST Jon is Jon‘s heritage and his claim to the throne.

Let‘s assume Bran tells Jon his herritage in episode one.

Dany will find out about this in episode 2.

You now have only three episodes to give us another battle between Jon and Dany. Let’s assume Jon wins this (although his army is way weaker than Dany‘s (and she has two dragons)).

Jon would have obviously lost a lot of soldiers during that. How the hell is he now able to fight the White Walkers? Even if one dragon survived and is bound to Jon, he has no chance winning against the Night King. And there is also Cersei. She would never agree fighting for the North.

And during that you still have to answer a lot of questions, develope characters and give them dialogue which does not inclued starring each other to death on the battlefield.

You can obviously also have Jon and Dany fight at the end of the season as an „epic showdown“. But to defeat the WW and Cersei Jon needs Dany‘s help. I mean, he can also kill her and then expect her army to follow him. Which is super realistic. But to get back to the point, the season won‘t start with the WW and Cersei battle. There have to be at least 2 or 3 episodes before the first battle and than one episode between the first and the second battle. So now we only have one episode to turn them against each other and make it believable….

Instead of creating this mess, the better version would be that with the reveal of Jon‘s true family Daenerys realizes that the throne she always believed she wanted is a metaphore for a family and a home. She always wanted a place where she belonged. The quote from season 7 in Dragonstone „this does not feel like home“ is a proof for that.

She always thought her home is on Dragonstone. But she was wrong. Now she thinks if she is queen and in KL it would feel right. But I think everyone knows that this is not true.

And that’s what Daenerys needs to realize.

Besides, Jon already bent the knee to Daenerys as her queen (which makes his claim to the throne non existing). Him betraying her and demanding the throne is simply against his character.

That’s all for today. I thought this needs to be said. I hope you feel better jonerys fam :)

Besides, Jon already bent the knee to Daenerys as her queen (which makes his claim to the throne non existing). Him betraying her and demanding the throne is simply against his character.

That’s all for today. I thought this needs to be said. I hope you feel better jonerys fam :)
trail.content:
Mad Dany is stupid: An in-depth analysis of why there simply is no time for Dany going mad:

I really don’t think season 8 of Game of Thrones has enough time to give us a mad Dany while they have to deliver us:

- proper dialogue between these many characters who never met before (Dany x everyone)

- give us all the emotions while reuniting characters (Arya, Sansa, Jon, Bran)

- expand these relationships to make them more believable (how will Tyrion and Sansa interact? Will Sansa show Cersei what she has leaned from her?)

- continue plot lines from former seasons because that was one of the things that made Game of Thrones special (Will Arya kill Melisandre (Mel said they will meet again)?; will it be mentioned that Arya „would be Gendry‘s lady“?; will Euron get the golden company?; will he meet the second sons?; will they be loyal to Dany or change sides?)

- good character developments (how will Cersei interact now that Jamie left her?; what does the Night King want?; Will Arya become more sensitive?; Is Jamie now fully over Cersei?)

- long battles: there are at least 2 battles (White Walker battle and Cersei battle) and each will definitely be an episode long.

There might even be on against Euron or the battles are longer so you only have a maximum of 4 episodes left to create a reasonable Dark!Dany plotline while also including everything above. And yes I say reasonable because season 7 did NOT end with Dany burning people, it ended with her agreeing to destroy the Night King, traveling North to save Westeros, crying over Viserion and talking to Jon about her doubts (deserving the thrones).

As a conclusion: It ended with her being madly in love with Jon.

Why is this important?

Because the only reason why Dany would turn AGAINST Jon is Jon‘s heritage and his claim to the throne.

Let‘s assume Bran tells Jon his herritage in episode one.

Dany will find out about this in episode 2.

You now have only three episodes to give us another battle between Jon and Dany. Let’s assume Jon wins this (although his army is way weaker than Dany‘s (and she has two dragons)).

Jon would have obviously lost a lot of soldiers during that. How the hell is he now able to fight the White Walkers? Even if one dragon survived and is bound to Jon, he has no chance winning against the Night King. And there is also Cersei. She would never agree fighting for the North.

And during that you still have to answer a lot of questions, develope characters and give them dialogue which does not inclued starring each other to death on the battlefield.

You can obviously also have Jon and Dany fight at the end of the season as an „epic showdown“. But to defeat the WW and Cersei Jon needs Dany‘s help. I mean, he can also kill her and then expect her army to follow him. Which is super realistic. But to get back to the point, the season won‘t start with the WW and Cersei battle. There have to be at least 2 or 3 episodes before the first battle and than one episode between the first and the second battle. So now we only have one episode to turn them against each other and make it believable….

Instead of creating this mess, the better version would be that with the reveal of Jon‘s true family Daenerys realizes that the throne she always believed she wanted is a metaphore for a family and a home. She always wanted a place where she belonged. The quote from season 7 in Dragonstone „this does not feel like home“ is a proof for that.

She always thought her home is on Dragonstone. But she was wrong. Now she thinks if she is queen and in KL it would feel right. But I think everyone knows that this is not true.

And that’s what Daenerys needs to realize.

Besides, Jon already bent the knee to Daenerys as her queen (which makes his claim to the throne non existing). Him betraying her and demanding the throne is simply against his character.

That’s all for today. I thought this needs to be said. I hope you feel better jonerys fam :)

tags: a song of ice and fire

blog.name: chininja
blog.title: How 'bout No
blog.description:
Alyssa | Old millennial |
No to shipping wars
No to wank
Multi-shipping blog

body:
fall away resistance

Rating:T

Pairing: Jon/Sansa

Summary: Idek guys. Just a wee bit of angst inspired by the Break Up.

Jon was still recounting the latest prank he pulled on Sansa when he got off from work. He should be chuckling like a teenage boy but he couldn’t shake out the feeling, like lead had settled in his gut, when he remembered the look on her face after he drew a dick in the middle of a half-made reject of a painting he found in her room. He had to scrub a portion of the painting off with thinner so he could make space for his own art. He thinks he did more than okay.

But something about the way she stiffened and the thinning of her lips told him that it was something different. Too caught up in his own childish antics, he didn’t really take note of it until now. He thought they were still in the middle of pissing each other off in the World’s Worst™ Break-Up, both refusing to move out of the apartment they both bought, but something like guilt was niggling at him.

They weren’t always like this, Jon thought. Their relationship started out slow, a budding attraction that began to build upon a tentative sort of friendship. Yet somehow, they managed to bring out the worst in each other now. Sansa, whether intentional or not, always managed to make Jon feel like he’s disappointed her. And he doesn’t even know what he did. When this happens, Jon becomes too sullen and pushes her away.

Until he pushed too hard and she finally called it quits on them.

The funny thing is, Jon thinks, he’s still very much in love with her. He’s just god awful at words. But this thing that they have now? That’s all he can cling to because at least it’s still something with Sansa. Even if it is fucked up.

Before he reaches the apartment, he sees Jeyne and Arya talking inside both with boxes in their hands.

“Did you get all her clothes?” Jeyne asks her sister-in-law as she puts more of Sansa’s things in boxes.

“Yeah, I got all of them,” Arya responds distractedly. “What she needs 5 pieces of the same black dress for I’ll never - ” she stops mid grumbling when she spots him loitering by the door.

Jon has seen Arya stare at another human being coldly. She acted the wildest of the Starks with a protective streak to match and Jon has seen that look targeted at many of the creeps who dared to hassle her sister.

He just never expected to be at the receiving end of it, getting along as quickly as they did.

And Jon knew then that whatever he did to Sansa last night was enough for her to unleash Arya’s barely reigned in wrath on him.

He was about to open his mouth to apologize, even if he wasn’t really sure what he was apologizing for when she cuts him before uttering a sound.

“Her keys are on the table and her share of the lease is left in the bureau,” her voice was void of any warmth he may have gotten used to from her over the course of his relationship with her sister. Arya picks up the box by her feet and proceeded to head out. When she hovers by the door, he knows she wants to say something more.

“Just spit it out, Arya.” he closes his eyes, bracing himself for a tirade.

“Out of all the assholes she dated, I never thought you’d be the one capable of hurting her the most, Jon.”

Jon can’t open his eyes after hearing those words, already feeling his guilt from earlier transform into something nastier. He only opens them to see her walk away.

“Jon,” he turns at the sound of his voice and sees Jeyne’s pitying face. “Sansa asked that you be given this.” She hands him an envelope with his name written in her neat script.

Jon snaps out of an emotionally induced paralysis when Jeyne moves to leave. “Please Jeyne,” he croaks out, afraid of this moment being the punctuation to their messy relationship. “Can you at least let me know what I’ve done? How can I - what can I do to -”

He’s a mess, he knows he’s a mess because just the thought of not having Sansa in any capacity in his life is giving him a panic attack.

Jeyne just gives him the same pitying look. “Just read her note, Jon.” It isn’t until he hears the door click that he remembers to release the breath he has been holding in.

As if in a trance, he goes inside what used to be their room. It was bare of anything with her things gone and with him setting up camp in the living room. He sees her keys on the bedside table and stops at the painting of a lake from his childhood - the one where his mom used to take him as a boy. It had a pleasant shade from a nearby oak tree with a tire swing hanging from one of its branches.

It was the painting he drew a dick on and he could kick himself for not recognizing it right away.

He hastily opens the envelope, his heart pounding because My God Sansa -

He unfolds the letter and collapses on the bed.

Jon -

You win. You get to keep the apartment.

I want you to know, I don’t regret you or the time we spent together. I just regret that we both suck terribly at communicating. I love loved love you. You helped me believe in people again, and I’m always going to be grateful for that.

You were good to me - the last few months notwithstanding. I guess we’re just not good for each other.

The painting, as you may have deduced, is the one from your childhood you told me about before. I sneaked out a photo from your albums while you were gone. Don’t worry, it’s taped to the back of the frame.

I wanted to give it as a peace offering. An olive branch, I guess.

I don’t resent you for what you did. I think it just made me realize that whatever this is that remaibs between us is probably best left alone. We’ve been broken up for a while now after all.

I wish you all the best,

Sansa.

His hand clenches over her letter.

“Shit.”

He sees her keys on the bedside table and stops at the painting of a lake from his childhood - the one where his mom used to take him as a boy. It had a pleasant shade from a nearby oak tree with a tire swing hanging from one of its branches.

It was the painting he drew a dick on and he could kick himself for not recognizing it right away.

He hastily opens the envelope, his heart pounding because My God Sansa -

He unfolds the letter and collapses on the bed.

Jon -

You win. You get to keep the apartment.

I want you to know, I don’t regret you or the time we spent together. I just regret that we both suck terribly at communicating. I love loved love you. You helped me believe in people again, and I’m always going to be grateful for that.

You were good to me - the last few months notwithstanding. I guess we’re just not good for each other.

The painting, as you may have deduced, is the one from your childhood you told me about before. I sneaked out a photo from your albums while you were gone. Don’t worry, it’s taped to the back of the frame.

I wanted to give it as a peace offering. An olive branch, I guess.

I don’t resent you for what you did. I think it just made me realize that whatever this is that remaibs between us is probably best left alone. We’ve been broken up for a while now after all.

I wish you all the best,

Sansa.

His hand clenches over her letter.

“Shit.”

body: When someone speaks about -new rebellion, new love story (especially great) , political Jon Snow, cruel Daenerys,new”Dance with the Dragon”, battle of Dany and Jon, battle of Dany-Jon-Cersei-NK and I realize that there is only 6 episode left 🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️
